intro: Spyridium rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved spyridium, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and rounded, leathery leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or dry habitats. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or greenish-white, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. Spyridium rotundifolium is a hardy shrub that thrives in well-drained conditions and is relatively drought-tolerant.
